Icon + Text Blocks

The design feature mimics the icon + text blocks in CourseArc, and can be used with either paragraph or header text to create decorative visual interest on a page.

Note: Icons must be Michigan Virtual's Dark Teal (#115e6e) in order to ensure they always mesh well visually with our header styles.

Icon + Text Lists

Use this list version of the icon + text block to highlight a short list of important information. It is not required that you format lists in this way. Icons here can be considered decorative, so no alt text is necessary.

Note: This arrangement is not a substitute for a bulleted list. In other words, this feature is only to be used in those situations where each icon is different. Reference the examples below. If you wish to format listed content as an ordered or unordered list, please use that feature found in the Text Templates section of these templates for consistent bullet/numbering formatting in all courses.

Learn how to change icons and icon color in this video tutorial! 

This is an example of content that might pair well with a series of different icons:

  • Use the settings menu to adjust your preferences. 
  • Use the source code edit panel to make style changes to your response.
  • Access your messages in the inbox tab.
  • Find all your saved ebooks, files, and PDF documents in the resource center.

Icon + Text Headers

You may choose to highlight headers with icons. If you use this design feature, do so consistently throughout the course. You may use a single icon many times throughout the course to highlight a similar type of content or you may use different icons each time you use a header throughout the course.
